intro: Phaseolus macrocarpus, commonly known as the giant kidney bean, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Central and South America and is characterized by its large, edible seeds that are often used in traditional cuisines. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, producing compound leaves and showy white or purple flowers. Its pods are thick-walled and contain several large, kidney-shaped beans. The plant is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which enriches the soil.
